[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/19483288/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/19483288)

Coverage decreased (-0.008%) to 14.169% when pulling **926534bbe82206cee3d8e5b81838f7aa9c9eaa04 on peng-yongsheng:fixed/bugs** into **474b25e768bf710395f7e84654eecef04e2b9510 on apache:master**.
https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/backend/backend-alarm.md

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9078468/46852198-c1cb2900-ce2c-11e8-88e2-9c3db2b11eb5.png)
如图所示，《1》没有和拓扑树连在一块，单独出来了，
其实他应该和《2》联系在一块的，但是少了n个segement，导致链路断裂，比较明显的错误是：
1）红色项目调用方法《2》的consumer，
2）红色项目调用方法《1》的provider，
然后就和《1》联系在一块了；
《3》所示的调用链完全丢失了；
《4》4所示的调用链是正常的，其实《2》《3》的结构应该和4一样，但是却出现了错误。

> SkyWalking Zipkin is incubating for this reason, we didn't test for the different scenario. Could you post your trace data in zipkin format here? Or run debug to find out why NPE in `buildRef(SegmentBuilder.java:238)` do you mean these trace data : ``` Zipkin A-->C(http) | OK A-->B(http)
A-->C(http)

You need to read document, it alreadys said es 5 is required. You could use es 6 after skywalking 6 released.
See collector's logs, you will know why. From your prev question, maybe wrong es version.

> 查看收集器的日志，您将知道原因。从您的上一个问题，也许是错误的ES版本。

Ok, thank you
There is no such thing about being based on OpenTracing. We have supported OpenTracing Java 0.30 API by using agent bridge. There is all.

English is only supported here. The trace segments show in the same trace shows context propagation is right. The segments missing are another story, could because
- The agent can't talk to the backend if this just missed in some time.
- There is a leak in your case, the segments are never finished(This is my guess)

Undertow 2.x is already in the list, https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/Supported-list.md

And undertow 1.x PR is still open, https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/pull/1519, ping the contributor @cloudgc
Do you mean in SkyWalking backend cluster? If so, YES. At least yes in v5.
@wu-sheng  ,sorry for reply to you so late.becase of environment, I have not  run the testcases yet. Test as soon as  the conditions are met.

(1) A lot of cases have happens, so it can't be caused by missing in some time
![错误的链路图1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9078468/46737594-7995f480-ccce-11e8-9d1f-5c0bdb5c81b1.png)
![错误的链路图2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9078468/46737620-8dd9f180-ccce-11e8-8819-a5f18e867f59.png)
(2) f my segment is not completed, there is no possibility of a complete link. But now there is a complete link, as shown below.
![正确的链路图](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9078468/46737500-33d92c00-ccce-11e8-929f-76a647cb95ff.png)

I noticed that when I needed to intercept very few projects (two), there was no problem with the trace topology. but when I added another project monitor, there were almost incomplete trace topology, so I wondered if  something wrong in project.

> I noticed that when I needed to intercept very few projects (two), there was no problem with the trace topology. but when I added another project monitor, there were almost incomplete trace topology, so I wondered if something wrong in project.

Have you checked the ElasticSearch and Backend payloads? If Backend is in high throughputs, it will trigger agents to ignore traces.

It also has the problem in the local test for single testing. 
If the load is a problem, how much is the load on the line?

> It also has the problem in the local test for single testing.

That should be easy to address. Try to learn remote debug, then you could know why a single request causes some missing segments.

> If the load is a problem, how much is the load on the line?

CPU and disk write are important metrics for backend and ElasticSearch
Can you give me some guidance on how to do it? Now I don't know where to start. I don't know the source code, so I don't know where to debug it.

Here are the same status of project and community.

1. 30+ Companies using, announced in public #443 and [powered-by](https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/powered-by.md) page
1. ~70 Code Contributors in GitHub
1. More than 100 Contributors supports us for blogs, meetup, public speech and conference
1. 4500+ stars in GitHub (only main repo). Forgive me, I love number game, this is not an Apache requirement.
1. 800+ issues (including questions) been solved in incubating stage.
1. DotNetCore, NodeJS, PHP agents provided by community
+1 Great！

We helped the .NET Core community provide APM solution that can be used in production, and we also got more and more [feedback](https://github.com/OpenSkywalking/Community#community) from the community.

No. There is no such thing in our ES types.
Welcome our new contributor.

> How often does the agent report data to the collector? Can it be configured?

Consume per 20 ms. See `TraceSegmentServiceClient#L69`. We use DataCarrier's default settings. It is not open now.

> How big is the agent buffer setting? Can it be configured?

See `org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.conf.Config#Buffer`. Default channelSize * bufferSize. You could set anything in Config through `agent.config`
Done.

Metrics name is incorrect. 
* instance_jvm_memory_max_heap -> instance_jvm_memory_heap_max
* instance_jvm_memory_max_noheap -> instance_jvm_memory_noheap_max
